intro: Genista sagittalis subsp. delphinensis, commonly known as the Delphinine Broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions. It produces small, yellow flowers in early spring, followed by linear seed pods. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
